isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - POWER TAKE OFF: ROCKWELL REAR ENGINE MOUNTED - CLEAN AND INSPECT - INSPECTING THE PARTS

svcprocinfo.para: It is important to inspect all parts before the PTO is assembled. Check all parts for wear and replace damaged parts. Replacement of damaged parts now will prevent failure of the assembly later.

svcsubproc.title: Ball Bearings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the ball bearings for wear and damage. Make sure the bearings rotate in the race. Make sure the outer race is not worn or damaged. Replace any worn or damaged bearings.

svcsubproc.title: Gears
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the teeth of the gears for wear and damage. Inspect the gears for cracks or pits. Replace gears that are worn, damaged or cracked.

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the splines for wear and damage. Make sure the output shaft is not twisted. Make sure threads on the end of the shaft are not worn or damaged. Replace the output shaft if worn or damaged.

svcsubproc.title: O-Rings and Oil Seals
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the O-rings and the oil seals for cuts and cracks. Make sure the parts are not brittle or hard. Replace any worn, damaged or hard O-rings and oil seals. If the oil seals are removed, they must be replaced.

svcsubproc.title: Case Housings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the case housings for cracks. Replace if required. Welding repairs are not permitted.

svcsubproc.title: Output Yokes
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the seal surface, the splines and the end of the output yoke for wear and damage. Do not sand or grind the seal surface. Replace any worn or damaged parts.
